title: Kai'Sa will never be a true Void affiliate
body:
She's a boob girl in a suit. She's from the desert and talks with an Australian accent. She's not even remotely maddened by the Void, in fact she bleeds confidence, and has next to no fear of it whatsoever.

Then Riot slaps us in the face by giving her a fucking popstar skin.

I can live with Kai'Sa retaining her human form, but she needs to be a lot less mentally sound given she had to fight for her life on a daily basis, and merged a fucking VOID creature to her skin, which in itself should come with a severe mental drain. She has not so much as a scar or marking on her body, doesn't even hint at her mentality changing when she fully equips the suit, and is the most godawful piece of wasted potential I've ever seen.

She doesn't even have meaningful interactions with her fucking father, Kassadin.

This is late, but too bad. Every time I look at this stupid login screen I'm reminded of this trash.

replies.body:
That's not for you to decide. I can dress a character in an onesie or a bikini at this point and claim he/she comes from the underworld known as void. Its a character I created. I have the freedom and the will to implement any background I see fit for he/she. 

These characters are fictional, meaning real world rules and standards can't or shouldn't apply to them. You cannot sue them, you cannot judge them. They're the way they are just the way you are in your own world.

Eh. Everyone can judge everything. That’s just life. For example, you can judge by design whether the character has themes that fit what you are interested in reading or learning about. That’s a useful tool we all develop to wade through the over abundance of media in the modern day world. 

What you can’t do is claim your judgments are universal. You can only say them and try to put them in a convincing context. 

For example one look at the K/DA skins made me not want to learn anything more about them. I don’t like that kind of music. I don’t care for that kind of design. So I make a judgment that it is not worth getting invested in. 

That’s different from me saying “K/DA is the worst and will never be a true music skin line like my favorite [whatever the metal band skin line is]!”

That's just life, which is again why I mentioned the fact that these characters aren't part of "life" you're describing here. If you think otherwise then go ahead and sue an online character that holds no copyright claim on any other company just because you find her or him, offensive in design or not to your liking, Snowflake.

Out of all the arguments you have made, you picked the most meh one.

You can shame her all you want, but 2B is dressed like a french maid fetishist and she was a compelling character.

> She doesn't even have meaningful interactions with her fucking father, Kassadin.

This one makes sense. One of Kassadin's most defining personality traits is that he thinks his family is dead. He's currently on a reckless "nothing left to lose" rampage against the void and doesn't seem to care about sharing his knowledge about the void hearts with others. 
If Kassadin were to learn Kaisa is alive, it would lead to a drastic change in character, which is probably why the voice lines are set up to show they haven't met.
Kass is not her dad. Malz threw his daughter into the void, but Kai Sa's lore states her parents died when she was younger.
That’s Kass’s old lore. Now he just lost her to the Void.

I can't find anything saying Malzahar threw Kassadin's daughter into the Void. Can you give the source for that?

For Kai'Sa, her lore states that her friends and family, **who were trapped in the caverns**, died. There is no mention of her family that wasn't present on that day, aka her father. The exact quote is
> Kaisa regained consciousness to find herself trapped underground. She was filled with crippling fear, but there was still hope; she could hear the faint cries of other survivors. They called out to each other feebly, repeating their names one by one like a mantra. Sadly, by the third day, hers was the only voice left. Her friends and family were all gone. She was alone in the darkness.

"Gone" doesn't necessarily mean dead, just that they are not currently present.

Additionally, Kai'Sa has voice lines towards Kassadin that leave little room for doubt:
> Huh, memories of my father come at the strangest moments.
Reunions can be so bittersweet.
Could it.. be true?
It smells like home here.
Father?

But I get where you're coming from. Riot has made a point of not confirming Kai'Sa is the daughter of Kassadin. I personally think it's because they want to preserve the tragedy of Kassadin's story and are maybe hinting at a future lore release featuring the reunion of the two.
I see your point. RIot does tend to leave room for us to fill in the blanks.

>I can't find anything saying Malzahar threw Kassadin's daughter into the Void. Can you give the source for that?

apparently he's going by the old non-canon joj lore
Does either lore confirm they are father/daughter? I know his daughter ended up in the Void and he’s looking for her, but was there confirmation that Kai’sa is her?

No, but somewhat yes.
It's never been explicitly stated that Kai'Sa is his daughter. But almost every mention of Kassadin ends with "[Is it possible his daughter might've come back?](https://youtu.be/XyIZ0q9DvkY?t=1362)" or something similar. I just wrote my personal theory as to why that is, so I'm just gonna copy-paste it here.
> I personally think it's because they want to preserve the tragedy of Kassadin's story and are maybe hinting at a future lore release featuring the reunion of the two.

Alright so multiple things here. First, Riot literally did research on the psychology of victims of traumatic events to get a better grasp of what kind of people they are, at least the ones that survive. One of things they noted that are most important to such victims are their memories of happier times as a way of having hope for happier times in the future. Kai Sa is obsessed with her memories and she constantly reminds you and herself of what's important, as if this were a compulsion for her. It's pretty clear here that her own mental stability is hardened to the point that horrors aren't even a dent to her. The way is see it, she's simply numb to it all and the only thing she bothers to focus on is her memories and her mission to stop the void. Next, is her suit. It's acceptable at worst, and fitting at best. I don't understand why people complain so much about this when jinx literally has a bikini and boot shorts. Kayn and Braum are literally shirtless models. No one complains about the sexual nature of characters unless it has to do with females that even remotely have curves. She's wearing a skin-tight void monster. Why is it skin tight? Because it literally replaces her skin and is hard as steel. Swords bounce off it without so much as a scratch. There is much more evidence that this void creature takes a physical toll rather than a mental one. It feeds on other void creatures, so its cannibalistic, and shows no inclination that it would feed on someone's sanity. It is also very possible that this voice creature has regenerative properties which would explain Kai Sa's lack of scars. Above that, is the complaint that she isn't void enough. The flaps on her legs open and under them is what this creature did to her thighs. They are literally purple void flesh with no human qualities about them. For all we know, the only human part of Kai Sa left is her face and neck. Even then, when she wears her mask, she becomes a cold-hearted predator. You can hear the changes in her voice and tone when she wears it. One final note, it is not confirmed that Kassadin is her father. There are a few lines that suggest that it may be the case and my bet is that Kass is her father, but we don't know and it hasn't been confirmed. She only refers to Kassadin when he's a game with her and as far as both of them know, their families are all dead. There is nothing left for them to linger on.

PS. South African voice over, not Australian{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
Kass is not her father. Her lore states that her mother and father died when she was a kid. Kassadin's lore states that Malz threw his daughter into the void in front of himl.

Could I ask where you get that Malzahar threw his daughter into the Void in front of him? Kassadin's bio says he wasn't present when the Void consumed his village. And then it says

>When he finally reached the place where his village had once stood, he found only shifting sand and rubble. He clawed at the debris until his hands bled, screaming out his wife and daughter’s names, though no answer came.

And then it doesn't have any scene with Malzahar and implies that they've never met, though Kassadin does seek him.

That...was actually in the original lore, in one of an entries for the Journal of Justice. Happened in..i think the old Zaun, Malzahar tried to sacrifice her, Kassadin show up and tried to stop it, she got sicked in, Kassadin got blamed for a power outage. The usual.
That stuff hasn't been canon in years so I'm wondering if this person can see some modern lore I'm missing =/
Yup, while there's a lot of teasing and hinty stuff,  it's at most a headcanon, at least for now

I agree with you and spideraxe, but it is definitely in the realm of possibilities. Even if they're both convinced that their families are dead, I'm willing to bet Riot is gonna pull a fast one on us. Maybe we get a short story where they meet each other. All I'm sayin is it isn't confirmed/ not canon, but it's hella spicy. They're bound to run into each other at some point and I'm excited to see where it leads

This is the same thing with super heroes. They not only have amazing powers and fight crazy villains, but they get used to it. They see it as normal and they arent disturbed by new evils and craziness. Watch Infinity War and note how none of the heroes reacts with fear or horror but they see fighting as a normal thing. It is the same with K/S. SHes used to her new life.

You have to keep in mind what that Void creature is doing while it's there.
